selected_quotes: Martin Asplund, A.Jacques Sauval et al.: The chemical composition of the Sun

q&a.title: What is the heaviest stable element in the center of the sun due to Photodisintegration?
q&a.summary:
Source that got me curious (page 5):  http://astro1.physics.utoledo.edu/~megeath/ph6820/lecture27_ph6820.pdf

High energy photons can cause larger, less stable elements to undergo fission.

Uranium for example can photo-disintegrate, or, I think the correc

wikipedia.title: Metallicity
wikipedia.summary: In astronomy and physical cosmology, the metallicity or Z is the fraction of mass of a star or other kind of astronomical object that is not in hydrogen (X) or helium (Y).
